__e: Here's the thing. Usually, when I meet a woman, she sees the chair right away, and I can tell from the look in her eye whether she's okay with it or not.
Look... I love that you don't see this chair anymore, and for the most part, I don't either.
He's a long way from my chair, as are you.
When you didn't want the surgery, I felt like I had to understand why. And, uh... you know,
I mean, here's a guy that's in a wheelchair, who's getting this woman off.
So we got a guy who fired a shot from a wheelchair and then escaped on foot.
Yeah, but I said no, and what if he thinks it's 'cause he's in a wheelchair?
I got a kid in a wheelchair outside the stadium, wanting to go to the game but unable because he didn't have the money for a scalped ticket.
If it's not somebody else's fault that I'm in this chair, man, then whose is it? It's yours.
Believe me, Mrs Hinkle, instead of him needing this chair I wish it was me.
I'd just like to sit here and look at you and the children and this place.
Your mother takes to wandering the streets, she gets hit by a bus,
And this... is the Captain's chair.
Oh, no, I draw the line at him sitting in the president's chair.
Because I just want you to remember that I'm still sitting in the big chair, see?
I have to have at least one more easy chair.
So I'll remember there's a chair on this side, right?
On the contrary, I think I may be doing a little more than keeping the Colonel's chair warm, ma'am.
If we're to survive, or for that matter, get back to Earth one day, then I'm convinced that this chair is the only way to do that.
- [Groans] - But... If we get there first, the chair's ours.
I just want you to know that now that this chair is in here, I really feel like it's my home too now.
